solution_line_template: Therefore, after 1 year his portfolio has grown to ${initial_portfolio} + ${first_year_gain} = $<<{initial_portfolio}+{first_year_gain}={after_first_year}>>{after_first_year}

He then adds ${additional_investment} to this total, so his new portfolio total is ${after_first_year} + ${additional_investment} = $<<{after_first_year}+{additional_investment}={portfolio_after_addition}>>{portfolio_after_addition} at the beginning of year 2

Next, this total grows by 10%, so he gains ${portfolio_after_addition} * {second_year_growth_rate} = $<<{portfolio_after_addition}*{second_year_growth_rate}={second_year_gain}>>{second_year_gain} across year 2
Thus, after year 2, his portfolio is worth ${portfolio_after_addition} + ${second_year_gain} = $<<{portfolio_after_addition}+{second_year_gain}={final_portfolio}>>{final_portfolio}
